alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 3:45AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Clay and southeastern Cass Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 345 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Horace, or 11 miles southwest of Fargo, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Horace around 350 AM CDT. West Fargo and Wild Rice around 355 AM CDT. Prairie Rose, Frontier and Briarwood around 400 AM CDT. Reile`s Acres around 405 AM CDT. Fargo around 410 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Moorhead Airport and West Argusville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 55 and 82. Interstate 94 in North Dakota between mile markers 335 and 352. Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
